citeinfo.title: Northwest Forest Plan (NWFP) Land Use Allocations (LUA) 2013
citeinfo.othercit: Will be published with 20-year NWFP Effectiveness Monitoring Report

descript.abstract: This is an ESRI Polygon Feature Class layer of the Land Use Allocations (LUAs) as described in the Northwest Forest Plan (NWFP) Record Of Decision (ROD), 1994. This is an interagency product and should be regarded as the official spatial representation for these land allocations, as of August 2013. The intent is that it be used for large-scale regional monitoring purposes only, such as the NWFP Effectiveness Monitoring effort. Please refer to the "Use constraints" section of this metadata for further guidance on the use of these data.
descript.purpose: This layer was created as an update to the 2009 version of the LUA map. It is intended to accomplish the following: 1) provide more accurate and up-to-date LUA boundaries based on a variety of newly available data sources, and 2) correct attributing errors identified in earlier versions of the map. The catalyst for the update was to provide a more accurate layer for use in the 20-year NWFP Effectiveness Monitoring Reports.
descript.supplinf:
The Northwest Forest Plan is a set of amendments to individual forest plans described in the Record of Decision for Amendments for Forest Service and Bureau of Land Management Planning Documents Within the Range of the Northern Spotted Owl (April 1994). Information on Land Use Allocations can be found on pages A-4, C-1, and C-8-48 in Attachment A (Standards and Guidelines) of the ROD.
NOTE: Regarding this layer, no attempt was made to map Riparian Reserves as a separate LUA. Therefore, they exist as an unmapped allocation within all other LUAs.

idinfo.accconst: This layer will be made available to the public upon publication of the 20-year NWFP Effectiveness Monitoring Report.
idinfo.useconst: This layer should be used for landscape level analyses, and not for site specific land ownership or land use allocation determination. Accuracy of the various data layers used to compile this layer vary widely. By no means is this layer to be used as a legal description of land ownership or use. During the compilation of this layer, every effort was made to locate and utilize the most current information. However, due to the large number of different land owners and data sources involved, no guarantees are to be implied as to the absolute accuracy of this layer.

cntinfo.cntpos: Old Forest & Spotted Owl Monitoring Lead

cntperp.cntorg: Pacific Northwest Region USDA Forest Service (Region 6)

idinfo.datacred: Pacific Northwest Region USDA Forest Service (Umpqua NF, Roseburg, OR) and the US Fish & Wildlife Pacific Region (Regional Office, Portland, OR).
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows Server 2008 Version 6.0 (Build 6002) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcGIS 10.0.5.4400

attracc.attraccr: No accuracy assessment performed. Attributes are estimated to be accurate for all general polygons. However, line boundaries identifying allocations may have some positional inaccuracy.

dataqual.complete: Data set is complete for Northwest Forest Plan area

cntperp.cntorg: US Forest Service Pacific Northwest Region, US Department of Agriculture

procstep.procdesc: Starting with 2009 LUA layer, acquired the most up-to-date ownership layers from a wide variety of land owners within the NWFP area. Ray Davis and Rich Young were instrumental in tracking down many of these data layers. Painstaking effort was made to resolve slivers and gaps that existed between adjacent ownerships. Numerous personal communications were made with various land use managers and GIS specialists/analyst in order resolve errors and discrepancies between datasets.

srcinfo.srccontr: Management Areas for the Six Rivers National Forest, California.

citeinfo.title: S_R05_SRF.MgmtArea
citeinfo.othercit: Copied from internal forest service server

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

enttyp.enttypd: Land use allocations defined in the Northwest Forest Plan area

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

overview.eaover: Contains three fields: UNIT describing the local administrative unit LUA describing the Land Allocation under the Northwest Forest Plan AGENCY describing the Major Federal Land Management Agency

cntperp.cntorg: US Forest Service Pacific Northwest Region, US Department of Agriculture

dataIdInfo.idPurp: This layer was created as an update to the 2009 version of the LUA map. It is intended to accomplish the following: 1) provide more accurate and up-to-date LUA boundaries based on a variety of newly available data sources, and 2) correct attributing errors identified in earlier versions of the map. The catalyst for the update was to provide a more accurate layer for use in the 20-year NWFP Effectiveness Monitoring Reports.

The intent is that it be used for large-scale regional monitoring purposes only, such as the NWFP Effectiveness Monitoring effort. Please refer to the "Use constraints" section of this metadata for further guidance on the use of these data.
